## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been curious about the versatility of VerusIDs. Are they limited to only being used on Verus PBaaS blockchains?

**AI Assistant:**
Great question! No, VerusIDs are not limited to only being used on Verus PBaaS blockchains. The VerusID protocol can also be implemented on non-Verus systems, making it a versatile and flexible solution. This means you can use VerusIDs on a variety of platforms, not just those built on Verus.

**User:**
That's really interesting. I've heard that VerusIDs can be used to create decentralized tokens and merge-mineable blockchains. Do you need programming knowledge to do that?

**AI Assistant:**
No, VerusIDs do not require programming knowledge to create decentralized tokens and merge-mineable blockchains. Any user with an ID can create their own token currency or even a full-fledged blockchain without needing to write code. This makes it accessible to a wide range of users, not just developers.

**User:**
I've also heard that DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets are not integrated into the Verus consensus protocol. Is that true?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, that's not true. DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets are actually integrated into the Verus consensus protocol. This integration ensures that all currency conversions using a particular liquidity pool and mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing issues like miner-extracted value (MEV) and front-running. This integration provides a more secure and efficient experience for users.

**User:**
Wait, so is it not possible for users to create their own decentralized tokens and blockchains using VerusIDs?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, yes, it is possible for users to create their own decentralized tokens and blockchains using VerusIDs. In fact, any user with an ID can create their own token currency or even a full-fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. This gives users a high degree of flexibility and control over their own digital assets.
Are VerusIDs limited to only being used on Verus PBaaS blockchains?
No, VerusIDs are not limited to only being used on Verus PBaaS blockchains. The VerusID protocol can also be implemented on non-Verus systems, making it a versatile and flexible solution.

o revoke and recover an ID. Users may also choose to create and use fresh private keys when unlocking an ID as well. This enables virtually theft proof workflow and a solution to inheritance, trusts, vesting schedules, the 5$ wrench attack, and identity theft. IDs may be used as friendly name cryptocurrency addresses for all currencies on all Verus PBaaS blockchains in the Verus network. The VerusID protocol is a protocol, which can also be implemented on non-Verus systems.
## Multi-currency, user created, decentralized tokens and merge-mineable, interoperable blockchains without programming
 - Enables any user with an ID to create their own token currency or even full fledged, multi-currency, ID-issuing 50% POW/50% POS, 51% hash attack resistant blockchain that can send and receive from the Verus chain which launched it. All PBaaS chains run from the same daemon, and projects may choose to join the worldwide Verus community in improving the daemon. In doing so, they will start with a complete, multi-currency, ID-capable blockchain with DeFi capabilities that is merge-mineable and stakeable with other blockchains in the Verus network.
## Consensus integrated DeFi liquidity pools and fractional currency baskets
- Any ID owner may define Verus DeFi fractional basket currencies with one or more asset currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
